resources.string: Contains toggles for HBM and DC Dimming

Anti-Flicker Mode (AFM) reduces eye strain in low light conditions. (Note: reduces image quality and color production)

High Brightness Mode (HBM) allows the display panel brightness to go above the maximums stock value. Which helps in improving visibility in direct sunlight.

FPS Overlay shows overlay with current frames per second.

Content Adaptive Brightness Control (CABC) adjusts display and backlight brightness based on currently shown content, to reduce power consumption without degradation.
DC Dimming is currently not supported by the kernel
HBM is currently not supported by the kernel
FPS Overlay is currently not supported by the kernel
CABC is currently not supported by the kernel
